Istri yang Dianiaya Bos Hotel di Makassar Tolak Damai, Kasus Tetap Lanjut
01 Nov 2019, 18:21 by Hermawan Mappiwali
Makassar - E, istri yang dianiaya suaminya, bos hotel di Makassar berinisial H menolak damai. Kasus penganiayaan yang dipicu nasi goreng gratis ini tetap dilanjutkan polisi.
"Sejak kasus ini bergulir suaminya selalu upayakan damai. Tapi istrinya terutama keluarga istrinya tidak mau damai. Jadi kasus ini tetap lanjut," ujar Kasat Reskrim Polres Pelabuhan Makassar, Iptu Theodorus Echeal Setiyawan kepada wartawan, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Polisi sudah memeriksa 3 orang saksi dalam kasus penganiayaan ini yakni 2 orang kerabat korban dan satu orang pegawai hotel. Polisi juga sudah mengantongi hasil visum korban.
"Intinya kasus ini lanjut, sisa (sekarang) kami fokus pemberkasan," kata Iptu Theodorus.
Penganiayaan berawal saat korban bertemu rekannya di hotel milik H di Jl Lombok, Makassar, Rabu (23/10). Sebagai tuan rumah, korban menyuguhkan 5 piring nasi goreng gratis di lantai lima hotel kepada rekannya yang datang.
Namun jamuan nasi goreng korban justru membuat pelaku kesal. Pelaku tega memukuli istrinya itu dengan gantungan baju.
Suami dalam keterangannya kepada penyidik menyebut penganiayaan dilakukan karena merasa tidak pernah dihargai istrinya. Namun korban kepada polisi mengaku dianiaya karena memberikan nasi goreng gratis kepada rekannya.
"Ada teman (istrinya) datang, jadi ditraktirlah dia (teman istri H) nasi goreng. Masih ada teman-temannya sebagian di situ (di hotel) nah dia kasih tahu, 'Pak, saya kasih nasi goreng' (pelaku) marah, maksudnya (marah) karena gratis," kata Penata Urusan (Paur) Humas Polres Pelabuhan Makassar, Ipda Tumiar, Sabtu (26/10).
Tersangka dijerat Pasal 44 ayat 1 ayat 2 UU RI Nomor 23 Tahun 2004 tentang Penghapusan Kekerasan dalam Rumah Tangga.

Wife Persecuted by Hotel Boss in Makassar Rejects Peace, Case Continues
Nov 01 2019, 18:21 by Hermawan Mappiwali
Makassar - E, the wife who was mistreated by her husband, the hotel boss in Makassar with the initial H refused peace. The case of the persecution triggered by free fried rice is still continued by the police.
"Since the case is rolling, her husband always strives for peace. But his wife, especially his wife's family, does not want peace. So this case continues," Kasat Reskrim Makassar Port Police, Iptu Theodorus Echeal Setiyawan told reporters on Friday (11/01/2019).
The police have questioned 3 witnesses in this persecution case, namely 2 relatives of the victim and one hotel employee. The police have also pocketed the results of the victim's post mortem.
"The point is the case continues, the rest (now) we focus on filing," said Iptu Theodorus.
The persecution began when the victim met her colleague at H's hotel on Jl Lombok, Makassar, Wednesday (10/23). As the host, the victim presented 5 plates of free fried rice on the fifth floor of the hotel to her colleague who arrived.
But the victim's fried rice banquet actually made the offender upset. The perpetrator could beat his wife with a clothes hanger.
The husband in his statement to investigators said that the persecution was carried out because he felt his wife had never appreciated him. But the victim claimed to the police was mistreated for giving free fried rice to his colleague.
"A friend (his wife) came, so he treats him (H's wife's friend) fried rice. There are still some of his friends there (at the hotel), he tells me, 'Sir, I give fried rice' (the perpetrator) is angry, that is to say (angry) because it's free, "said Public Relations Stylist (Paur) Makassar Port Police, Ipda Tumiar, Saturday (10/26).
The suspect was charged with Article 44 paragraph 1 paragraph 2 of RI Law Number 23 of 2004 concerning the Elimination of Domestic Violence.
